text: Nicolás Martín Tripichio (born 5 January 1996) is an Argentinian footballer who plays as a full back or winger for Defensa y Justicia in the Argentine Primera División. ==Club career== Under Miguel Ángel Russo's coaching, Tripichio debuted professionally for Vélez Sarsfield in a 1–1 draw with Newell's Old Boys, in the 2015 Argentine Primera División. Although he mostly plays as a right full back, in that game he played as a left winger. ==International career== Under Miguel Ángel Lemme's coaching, Tripichio took part of the Argentina national under-15 football team that finished third in the 2011 South American Under-15 Football Championship. In 2013, the defender took part of the squad of the Argentina national under-17 football team that won the South American Under-17 Football Championship at home, under Humberto Grondona's coaching. He also took part of the 2013 FIFA U-17 World Cup. Tripichio also won with the Argentina national under-20 football team the 2015 South American Youth Football Championship. ==Honours== ;Argentina U-17 *South American Under-17 Football Championship (1): 2013 ;Argentina U-20 *South American Youth Football Championship (1): 2015 ==References== ==External links== *Profile at Vélez Sarsfield's official website *Profile at BDFA Category:1996 births Category:Living people Category:Argentine footballers Category:Argentine Primera División players Category:Club Atlético Vélez Sarsfield footballers Category:Argentina youth international footballers Category:Argentina under-20 international footballers Category:Sportspeople from Buenos Aires Category:Association football wingers Category:Association football fullbacks
title: Nicolás Tripichio
